result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony C Brewington was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to:  consecutive to each other, and any other sentences, and are to be served at the House of Correction if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
AS TO ALL COUNTS:  Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

No contact with firearms.
Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime.

No contact with K.B. unless approved by BMCW, Family Court (in an order dated after today's date), this court or by agent.
No physical discipline of any child.

A course in anger management.
Parenting classes.
Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

timeConds.notes: (as to each count) in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review on November 20, 2015.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony C Brewington

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony C Brewington in court.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.
Received & Filed, Pretrial Incarceration Credit form and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Anthony C Brewington in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.

**Sentences in counts 1, 2 & 3 are consecutive to each other, and any other sentences, and are to be served at the House of Correction if revoked.

AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 6 MONTHS. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS.
AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to 6 MONTHS. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS.
AS TO COUNT 3
The court sentenced the defendant to 6 MONTHS. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 30 DAYS (as to each count) in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-A course in anger management.
-Parenting classes.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with K.B. unless approved by BMCW, Family Court (in an order dated after today's date), this court or by agent.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No physical discipline of any child.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime.
*Court DENIED expungement. 

Filed: 
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, 3 per the Amended Information
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.

Defendant Anthony C Brewington in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Plea & Sentencing. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.  Received & Filed, Amended Information. Copy provided to defense, reading waived. 
COUNT 1: Misdemeanor Battery, contrary to Wis. Stat. 940.19(1), a class A misdemeanor.
COUNT 2: Misdemeanor Battery, contrary to Wis. Stat. 940.19(1), a class A misdemeanor.
COUNT 3: Misdemeanor Battery, contrary to Wis. Stat. 940.19(1), a class A misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court, defendant Anthony C Brewington not in court, in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion regarding defendant's prior missed court date. Discussion regarding bail. Case set for Plea & Sentencing at request of defense counsel. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Return on Warrant date rescheduled from 3/13/2015 to 3/10/2015 due to attorney availability.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 3/2/2015.
Bench warrant in file. Case set for a return on warrant date in branch 23 on 3/11/2015 at 8:30 AM.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($500.00 signature bond) ad

Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court.  Owen Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court ordered bail forfeited pending restitution and recompense.
FILED, INFORMATION AND AMENDED INFORMATION DOCUMENTS
Signed, Filed & Distributed, Stipulation and Order Regarding Use of Videotaped Statements.

Defendant Anthony C Brewington in court with attorney Mary D. Scholle.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Cindy Carlson.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 01-23-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with K.C.B., K.B. and L.K. unless as approved per Children's Court Orders or if Children's Court is not involved, unless as approved by the Bureau of Milwaukee Child Welfare

Defendant Anthony C Brewington in court with attorney Mary D. Scholle.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1/6/15 @ 1:30pm
